channel.title: Xbox 360 Con/LIVE/PIRS library
channel.description:
Well, I was bored yesterday so I went and found some information on the file formats that the xbox 360 uses to store saves, content, games, etc. I then proceeded to make a tool to print the information, thought some people might find it useful (and possibly help me expand upon it). Basically atm all it does is read the metadata information from the files, reading the actual file data seems to be slightly more confusing (the wiki page on free60.org really isn't helpful for that part). For now I'm simply posting this tool, when it's complete I will post the library along with documentation and, possibly, the source code. P.S. If you don't know how to get the files off of your xbox 360, this tool isn't for you! Output from a Just Cause 2 game save (obviously the thumbnails from the file are missing as this is a console application, but they are in the library):
C000 Type = Con LicenseEntries = LicenseEntry[] { FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF, Flags: 0 0000000000000000, Flags: 0 0000000000000000, Flags: 0 0000000000000000, Flags: 0 0000000000000000, Flags: 0 0000000000000000, Flags: 0 0000000000000000, Flags: 0 0000000000000000, Flags: 0 0000000000000000, Flags: 0 0000000000000000, Flags: 0 0000000000000000, Flags: 0 0000000000000000, Flags: 0 0000000000000000, Flags: 0 0000000000000000, Flags: 0 0000000000000000, Flags: 0 0000000000000000, Flags: 0 } HeaderSha1 = 69A8E5DCE72DA84BD7CE1709674BE9D167A96CD2 EntryId = 38682 ContentType = SavedGame MetadataVersion = 2 ContentLength = 1032192 MediaId = Omitted MajorVersion = 1 MinorVersion = 1 TitleId = 1396901863 Platform = 0 ExecutableType = 0 DiscNumber = 1 DiscInSet = 1 SaveId = 0 ConsoleId = Omitted ProfileId = Omitted StructSize = 36 Reserved = 0 BlockSeperation = 0 FileTableBlockCount = 256 FileTableBlock = 0 HashTableHash = BD308F48F7864BE0519F17A18E09AC1028B5DBF7 AllocatedBlocks = 220 UnallocatedBlocks = 1 DataFiles = 0 DataFileSize = 0 Reserved1 = 0 SeriesId = 00000000000000000000000000000000 SeasonId = 00000000000000000000000000000000 SeasonNumber = 0 EpisodeNumber = 0 DeviceId = Omitted DisplayName = string[] { "Just Cause 2 Auto-Save" "" "" "" "" "" "" "" "" "" "" "" "" "" "" "" "" "" } AdditionalDisplayName = string[] { "" "" "" "" "" "" } DisplayDescription = string[] { "" "" "" "" "" "" "" "" "" "" "" "" "" "" "" "" "" "" } AdditionalDisplayDescription = string[] { "" "" "" "" "" "" } Publisher = Title = Just Cause 2 TransferPolicy = DeviceId
Usage: LIBTESTER.exe [file] Accepts: CON/PIRS/LIVE files Requires: .NET Framework 3.5

item.title: Xbox 360 Con/LIVE/PIRS library
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

If you’re still working on this, http://www.game-tuts.com/community/forumdisplay.php/56-Programming-Discussion might help out a little. It’s mainly for individual game saves, and I haven’t seen too much source around, but it might be of some more assistance.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 Con/LIVE/PIRS library
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

[quote=“Cowie`, post:12, topic:336537”][quote author=m.dog311 link=topic=432907.msg3219169#msg3219169 date=1275011865]
Whenever the NXE update was. Which might have been before July of 09, I can’t really remember. All I do remember is that kernel 7371 is the last jtag-able kernel, and that was forever ago.

Might I also add that if you have an xbox 360 that has not been connected to live in quite some time, and has a kernel before that/old dashboard, then doing the jtag hack would be very profitable. People are paying $25 each for modded MW2 lobbies on se7ensins.com, and once you jtag your xbox you can unban it at any time.
[/quote]

'cept you need keyvaults and they cost hella nigdolla.[/quote]
I’ve seen them everywhere from $50-$200. The jtag usually go up to around 8 hours before being banned, and that’s plenty of time to get enough money for a new keyvault + some. The reason they cost so much is because the only way to get the keyvault from the xbox is with the NAND, which can only be retrieved with the jtag :\ So you’re basically paying for a new jtag every time…

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 Con/LIVE/PIRS library
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

I wouldn’t advise relying on that website. Some of the main parts of it have not been updated in a long time, such as:

http://free60.org/SMC_Hack

There is a new hack which can boot homebrew code in less than 5 seconds. See at the end of this document for a description how the hack works. For now, all we need to know is that this is a new way to exploit the well-known 4532 kernel, in a way which also works on updated machines, unless they have been updated by the summer '09 update. It also works on all hardware types.

Please also notice that from a functional side, the result will be the same as the KK-hack; it’s just much faster, works on more hardware and is more reliable. So it replaces the KK-hack, not less and not more.

Technical details are available on [1].


That hack was patched with the NXE update iirc, and that was forever ago. Also, you may want to take a look around the internet for the source code to some programs that do this. I know that the source code for an older version of USB XTAF was released not to long ago, and it does exactly what you are trying to do.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 Con/LIVE/PIRS library
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“atrox_, post:5, topic:336537”][quote author=the bank link=topic=432907.msg3184326#msg3184326 date=1271594678]
Is it in C#?

Either way very interesting!

I’m curious how work goes on the file tables, keep us posted! Also, you should link to the resources you are using so that anyone who uses this can know what each part means, even though for most of them the name is obvious. However, this would probably be even more important once you get into the actual file tables.
[/quote]
haven’t dled, but the name ends in JL which I presume is java library[/quote]It’s an executable file that requires the .NET runtime, so I strongly doubt that

I was just wondering what .NET language he chose.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 Con/LIVE/PIRS library
item.dc:creator: @newbiehacker newbiehacker
item.description:
@newbiehacker wrote:

It parses it all that is stored in the file (up to where the file tables start, I’m still working on that), atm the certificate at the beginning of each file (at least I believe it is a certificate) is only stored in a byte[] and not parsed or properly understood (All documentation I can find doesn’t properly explain what this chunk is).

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 Con/LIVE/PIRS library
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

Does your program output the values of predefined parts of the metadata or parse it all?

This is very interesting, a lot of the “variables” are rather easy to diagnose their purposes.

Read full topic

Basically atm all it does is read the metadata information from the files, reading the actual file data seems to be slightly more confusing (the wiki page on free60.org really isn’t helpful for that part).
